website_summaries.verdict: With easy assembly, quality construction, and plenty of room for preparing and cooking meals, this kamado grill is an excellent value.
pros: In addition to the cook space that is capable of fitting up to 15 burgers, this affordable, solidly built model features a handy cart with spacious prep space
Produces excellent results, thanks to the even cooking temperatures
cons: Rare reports of some rust developing, but usually after years of use

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and poor customer service. Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: This product boasts how it can handle high heat, but the paint on the bottom delaminated the first time I used it due to heat. I contacted customer service and they stated they don’t cover “overheats.” What kind of grill boasts how hot they can get and then has defects due to it?
customer_reviews.author: Meyersj03

customer_reviews.title: Best grill ever!
customer_reviews.text: Have to say I was a bit optimistic about the grill. This grill awesome! Holds heat well, and after only 1 grill already on bird with the best.purschased ever. Why did I wait this long to convert. Buyers considering you will not regret it! 4 16oz ribeyes, 2 8oz chicken breast, 4 corn on the Cobb, 2 whole zucchini’s, 4 whole jalapeño peppers. Plenty of space on the grill!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Sigler

customer_reviews.title: Great grill but it will rust
customer_reviews.text: In a perfect world it wouldn't get rained on and last forever. But since it's been rained on plenty the bottom rusted out on our last one after 3 or 4 years so we got another one. I guess if the kamodo joe doesn't rust it should be cheaper in the long run instead of buying these every 3-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used - Like New Description Inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a grill labeled Used - Like New damage to box only. This was not accurate at all. The grill I received had major dents and chipped paint in several places. So much so, that the lid did not line up correctly. There were also 2 missing utensil hooks. Overall, the quality of the grill was very good. I was able to regulate the temperature easily using tips from youtubers. One thing to note is that the grill is heavy. Made the mistake of assembling far from where it would sit. Even with wheels, it was not easily rolled to destination. Not a bad thing, just a note.
customer_reviews.author: gyrlfryday

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for the price, easy buy even if it only lasts less than 5 years.
customer_reviews.text: Have cooked on it about 6 times, seems to hold any temp very well. Temperature control is very easy as long as you close the dampers at the right times and learn to make minute adjustments. Quality was very surprising for a $300 grill that includes a cart. Downsides is that with all the accessories I wanted/needed total price of grill is over $500, but of course it works as a regular grill out of the box. But if you want to capitalize on all the features, you'll need the upgrades. Grilling and smoking have come out well so far, need to try still baking and roasting. I have high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre David Thurston

customer_reviews.title: Great Low Cost Smoker..
customer_reviews.text: WoW! What a great low cost alternative to the Big Green model. Supposedly it won't last as long as its ceramic counterpart. But my research tells me that these fail only if you run them at high temp for grilling. I use a standard grill for high temp grilling and only use this for low temp long smokes. No paint peeling or metal strain if you keep the temp in those 350 degree and below ranges. I've used a Big Green version many times. I've now used this a dozen times and it works the same. This will smoke equally as good in every way.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonPrimeUser1313

customer_reviews.title: Crappy pre fab metal won’t fit correctly
customer_reviews.text: At first glance your sold and after the reviews your buying it but when it gets to you it’s basically warped metal you have to bang together to fit properly and screws that you have to pry into place to make it grab. I guess if your not buying the 800$models you get crappy fabricated pieces. Otherwise the grill is awseome and cooks very well. But beware if you are not handy and think outside the box when building this thing. Buy with out the cart it might be much easier than all this scratched up metal parts
customer_reviews.author: OBI23.bs

customer_reviews.title: We received the package in VERY BAD Condition; however
customer_reviews.text: We received the package in VERY BAD Condition; however, except for one corner of the plastic top, the unit was OK. The plastic top is a big disappointment, but otherwise, the unit works well. I will eventually replace the plastic top with something much more substantial, like a butcher block top or granite.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Mudd

customer_reviews.title: Best BBQ meats I've ever had!
customer_reviews.text: I've been BBQing for several decades and always used firewood or propane for grilling. My son told me to get one of these Kamado charcoal grills and I will say that it makes THE BEST STEAK I've ever had in my life! Love the way you can BBQ in a hot 700 degree cooker or a slow 200 degree level. So flexible and so far I have loved everything I have cooked on it. I love the fact that it has one big side shelf instead of two smaller ones on each side.
customer_reviews.author: L.Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Akorn Wins Over Green Egg...
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this purchase! Awesome searing and smoking! Holds low temps very well and can get extremely hot as well. Haven't seen any issue with paint peeling that one of the reviewers posted. Must have left on very high temps (700 or above) for 12 hours or longer. Just have to slowly raise the temp for smoking at low temps. Don't raise it fast or you'll have a hard time getting it back to your desired temp. Overall an awesome grill !!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: It arrived without legs and one panel was t’s molded correctly to fit around the leg so I had to contact the grill company to send the parts. Took a week too arrive. But then they sent 3 left l-shaped legs and one right. They mailed it the next day. Could finally put it together. Looks great, and sturdy. A little difficulty lining up screws with some parts. Steel/iron don’t bend for a nail. Hopefully the grilling experience will make up for the all the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin

customer_reviews.title: Great just needs some quality control
customer_reviews.text: Quality isn’t the greatest as the lid on mine doesn’t latch at all the lid comes forward to much. Some of the pieces had to be forced to fit. But this is a very nice grill and it grills well.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia Duarte

customer_reviews.title: Its cheaper and for a novice it will do
customer_reviews.text: The grill achieves the high temperature (600+) and maintains that really well. The table combo is however very wobbly. In hindsight I should have bought it without the table. The grill itself is great for the price and am happy with it compared to the previous charcoal grills I was using. Way cheaper than the Kamado Joe, so am good
customer_reviews.author: Albanus Moguche

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value, amazing food
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!! I've had this Akorn for 3 months and it has been great. I had a few minor issues learning the airflow and controlling temps, but trial and error has been a great learning tool. I can get get it dialed in pretty easily now. I've done several cooks on it now, both grilling and smoking and the food has turned out great each time. My wife loves it and even my kids are gobbling up food they would have turned their nose to in the past! Great cooker for the money hands down!!

product_meta.title: Char-Griller E6520 AKORN Kamado Cart Charcoal Grill, 22", Ash
product_meta.description: Color:AshKamado style cooking comes from ancient cooking methods that used large clay ovens for insulation. Kamados of recent years are made of heavy ceramics. Char-Griller has developed this product for Kamado style cooking using innovative technology to make it more durable, convenient, affordable & Lighter weight than traditional ceramic kamados. This Kamado Kooker with cart can cook anything from burgers to fish to ribs to pizza. Truly the best food you will ever cook on a grill! Cart features 26" X 26" Of prep/serving space. Easy to assemble.
feature_bullets: Insulated design means more heat uses less charcoal and less airflow means insulated heat for juicy meat
314 Square inches of primary cooking space
Tubular steel cart construction, 26" X 26" Of prep/serving space
Dual adjustable dampers for maintaining specific temperatures
Cast iron cooking grates enhance flavors and heat evenly
